I bet the anime is rushing the whole animosity Giad has towards the 86. It barely makes sense as to why they hate them. Thus far is because of their skills and experience, not quite enough to go full nuts like this. I bet in the novel, or wherever this story comes from, it's explained better.

It's not just skills and experience, it's also jealousy and fear. You would be scared of anything you don't understand. They fear the 86 cuz they aren't afraid of the legion or even death, and they are jealous of them (especially the Marcel guy) because of their extreme skill gap. Also you are talking as if the whole of Giad military hates them, which is not at all true. Only a select few have this animosity towards the 86, which is quite realistic and makes sense.

Can't agree to that. ''You would be scared of anything you don't understand'' feels off. I don't know if there's a word for it, the closest I can think of is platitude, but that's not it. What I mean is stuff like ''People get angry because you're right'', ''Being a mom is the hardest job on the planet'', ''If they criticize you is because they're envious'' stuff like this gets abused in arguments a lot.

I get what you are saying, but in this case, the 86 hardly act like humans, atleast to the Giad soldiers' eyes. In fact they act like these crazed battle hungry soldiers who only want the battlefield and want to slay the legion as if it's some child's play. That's why they call them monsters, cuz they can't believe how they can defeat so many legion like this while having a smile on their face (we saw that in episode 16). They act like kids playing with toys in the park. No matter what you say, this ain't normal. Of course it is normal to the 86, but to the Giad soldiers it's not, cuz their lifestyle has been very different.

The amount of people here that don't understand the nuance in them saying they're going "because they're 86" is really incredible. THIS IS THEIR MISSION. They have survivor's guilt and have spend most of their teen and adult life on the battlefield, THE ENTIRE FEDERATION DEPENDS ON THEM NOW. They're not "going on a suicide mission because they want to die" they're going because they're the only ones capable enough to do it AND THE WAR ISN'T OVER. If they were to stop the only thing the federation would do is prolong their inevitable demise like San Magnolia was doing

Damn...Why did the writer had to include a character like frederica in this arc...it really messed up the whole "sole survivors" story for me. She had no business being friends with main squad and although I understand that she has her own reasons for "fighting" and things from the past she wants to correct I do not feel like she belongs between them. She really is just a kid after all and her whole vibe is just disturbingly childish compared to the 86 who have been through way more leading to them being more mature, grounded and more accustomed to the harsh war/ front lines environment. Maybe I'm thinking too much about it, but I don't know... Her character just annoys me a whole lot. Takes away attention from the thing our attention should be focused on and that is the living and lost comrades of Shin and the Reaper himself.
Fredericka is also a "sole survivor" of her clan. She doesn't have a family anymore.
"Because we're 86." No they chose you because you're suicidal. And Surprise! Not everyone wants to die.

just need to look deeper in the anime. There's a lot of lessons and clues tho. If you still don't understand them try reading the ln or manga or maybe try making your mind big.

s1 made sense. s2 where they wanted to go back to being soldiers made no sense. They were fighting for their honor as an 86. They also fought for the hope to live another day. They fought for the hope that everyone at the end of the battle can gather back together in their house, eat dinner together, watch fireworks together, LIVE together. They fought to protect their comrades, they fought so that maybe others can live a life without being trapped in their metal coffins.

Ahhh another one of those comments "questions go unanswered therefore the story is shit and it's tragic they made an anime about this". *Everybody who read this, ignore this guy, he's a lost cause, thank you*

2 fking seasons have passed and the story still does not explain how San Magnolia can control the 86 if they literally have no enforcement other than a ring of mines. Whoever is the leader of that country is absolutely retarded. Its like Russia is invading Ukraine without a single russian troop defending Russia itself. Does not explain why the rest of the spearhead squadron wants to die so much. LITERALLY NO ONE QUESTIONED Shin's decision to go back into metal coffins. At least one of them needs to show that they want to LIVE. I hate to compare this show to AOT but Erwin's last charge in aot clearly demonstrates the flaws of 86. When Erwin announced his suicide charge, Floch literally said, "of were gonna die anyway then why don't we die instead running away since its all meaningless." These 86 literally go back because "they feel like they don't belong there." Such a bs excuse and they don't justify that statement with even ONE solid reason. Getting called 86 occasionally is totally worth it for their life of luxury with the literal ruler of Giad federacy.

You really compared the 86 with Floch huh? Tell me, did Floch have to go through oppression, racism and forced to fight for a country while being called less than human ever since he was a kid? The 86 have extreme survival's guilt. They are all broken people. Go back and rewatch episode 13, they obviously aren't in a peaceful mind as you claim them to be.

you don't have to compare everything with AOT ,this is a unique series of its own
although I do agree with your opinion that they're suicidal , they were literally given the option to refuse , but then will be hypocrites and say they were chosen because they're 86 , even though they are being discriminated against right now , they don't have to emphasize every 5 minutes that they're 86

Huh? YES, they WERE chosen because they were 86. They were given the option to refuse by ONE woman. Theo was talking about how they were originally chosen for the mission.. because they are 86. They're not suicidal, they're just fighting to protect like they've always did. They don't want to sit back and die like a bunch of pushovers but rather want to fight until they die.. with pride. Since the beginning of the show.. they NEVER asked for pity. Instead of being treated like suicidal maniacs (which they aren't).. they could instead be given the "choice" to fight first. Except Wenzel and Ernst, nobody (the top brass) gave them a choice. Despite the fact that they'd fight anyway, the point is that the federacy treated them like 86 instead of their honor to fight. They're not "hypocrites" bruhhh ffs how dumb can people be. They're not even trying to 'emphasize' that they're 86.. they're just saying that to make themselves feel normal. Cuz that's how they've always been treated. Wherever they were. One or two dudes treating them equally isn't enough. They also had that back in republic. But the majority of them always look at them differently. It's nothing different here. "We were chosen because we're 86" and "We're going because we're 86" are two different things. If you can't understand the difference in what Theo stated, then you're just dumb. And the other dude who posted the op comment gave a bunch of complaints that didn't make the slightest sense. It's already been said in the first season how there were so many Legion. People don't pay proper attention and whine in the comments :')

what about when they were given the chance to refuse in season 2 , I will admit that I didn't give enough attention to the dialogues like I gave to re zero , but I sure as hell remember that they were being treated equally in the federacy , so why did they want to go back to the battlefield? because they didn't belong there?

You're retarded. You can't even remember that a few episodes ago, they literally volunteered to go back even though their lives were perfectly well inside Giad. I don't even like this show but I have a better memory of it than you.

Except they never lived normally. If you go back to episode 13, you can clearly see them struggling. And that's quite realistic, it happens to IRL soldiers as well. They feel like they don't belong there. Of course, no one would want to die unless you are Shin, but guess what? They all would one day meet their demise anyway if they don't take care of the legion now.

[6:53 timestamp onward] Go on to explain that the Morpho has powerful AA weaponry and how it's out of their own artillery range. I mean, you being slow to read simple dialogue shouldn't have anything to do with the show being bad.
Also, an AOT fan shouldn't be complaining about these characters' ages and what they've accomplished during then.üòÇü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
----
AOT and 86 don't go out of their way to make this a "kid's anime" (unlike Naruto and other shows), it's been HIGHLIGHTED countless times that within each show, whatever they do at their young age, it isn't "just because", the 86 are forced into doing suicide missions since they are a different race and in AOT it's lowkey just a "do or die" situation.
----
Every character is annoying for you? Okay buddy, go back to your AOT and please stay there. It's really a tragedy what happened to the lead characters in this show. (Being choked by a country you're giving your life for. Being a tool for a government that has no respect for human life.) And the tragedy isn't what makes the characters good, it's the way this writer made it so that they're realistic. The tragedy isn't all that they have to succeed in overcoming, there's also the mental and emotional imbalances. And thanks to the studio's care, all of the soundtracks and symbolical visuals here and there really immerses you in each of their journeys.
----
In my opinion, the "tsundere child queen" was a good addition. The show has very dark overtones, and having her as their comrade/little sister provides needed relief.
Sorry you can't enjoy this anime.

It's hard for me to understand...
They refuse to be treated as an "objects".
But they act like one.
it's called mental issues

They fight since its the only thing they know. None of them has found out what they want to do in the future once the war ends yet, and now that Shin thinks Lena is dead, they have no reason to say no to that mission

I get that part, I only have problem with their outburst on "don't pity us" topic.
Clearly they are rushing towards their meaningless deaths.
When in the war one must have a "will" to die, but also must value the life one has and must know what their actions weight.
Now... What they're doing...
First it's a huge insult towards people who saved them.
Second it's an insult towards their fallen friends, who sacrificed their lives and carried them forward.
Third, they mentioned, - they were fighting for their motherland, and now completely forgot it, huge insult towards the honour of the word and soldier's duty.

Hmmm let me see if I can clear some things up... #1 they never claimed to fight for there motherland they fight for themselves/Those who died/beat legion. #2 They clearly value their lives as they have come home from every mission the only logical argument is Shin. They don't want to die, they take risk deadly ones to complete the mission. It's what they were raised to do and if they hadn't the gov would have fallen. #3 They honour the fallen by continuing to fight "End the War" rather than the most experienced soldiers sit on their butt out of pity. #4 Ofc they don't want pity or peace, war and brutality is literally the only thing they have known from a young age. Most ppl can't just turn around and eat sweets watching TV and shiii after that. If anything your worse off adapting to that bc shiii will haunt you in your sleep...
